intro: Chaerophyllum hirsutum subsp. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth hogweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves that are typically divided into narrow segments. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in temperate climates.
